definition: to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards

sentences.english: I hitchhike from Tianjin to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我从天津搭便车去北京。

sentences.english: I hitchhiked from Tianjin to Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 我从天津搭便车去北京。

sentences.english: Evidently we have to hitch a passing car.
sentences.chinese: 看来我们得招手搭便车了。

sentences.english: Freeriding is a sport that has just recently come into vogue .
sentences.chinese: 搭便车是一个最近刚刚成气候运动。
他中途让一个搭便车的人上了车。

sentences.english: Sternly, he demanded to know what my parents thought about my hitchhiking.
sentences.chinese: 他很严肃地想要知道我的父母怎么看待我搭便车的。

sentences.english: He hitchhiked to Dover and, towards evening.
sentences.chinese: 他搭便车到了多佛，天快黑时。

sentences.english: The younger man would regularly hitch into Salton City to do his laundry and barbecue steaks at Franz's apartment.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人定时搭便车到沙尔顿市弗朗兹的公寓洗衣烤肉。

sentences.english: A:I like hitchhiking.will you go with me?
While driving alone at night you see an old man hitch-hiking. What would you do?
sentences.chinese: 深夜开车回家时路旁老人要求搭便车，我怎么做？

sentences.english: In experimental settings, people were subjected to free-riders who exploited them.
sentences.chinese: 在一项研究中里，人们屈从于搭便车者的剥削。

sentences.english: Her car broke down, so she had to hitchhike back home.
sentences.chinese: 他的车坏了，所以他只有搭便车回家。

sentences.english: Before this, I never understood why anyone hitchhiked.
sentences.chinese: 这之前，我一直不能理解为啥有人要搭便车。

sentences.english: It's very dangerous for females to hitchhike alone.
sentences.chinese: 女性单独搭便车是非常危险的。

sentences.english: All ears and eyes, a Zambezi River hippo ignores a hitchhiker.
sentences.chinese: 一头赞比西河河马对搭便车的小鸟熟视无睹。

sentences.english: One way is to restrict bacterial traffic.
sentences.chinese: 办法之一是限制细菌“搭便车”。

definition: to ride as a passenger/to travel by (car, plane etc)
by the way/while out doing sth else/conveniently
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
gangway/ramp (to board a ship or plane)
